title.text: RFC 3796:  Survey of IPv4 Addresses in Currently Deployed IETF Operations & Management Area Standards Track and Experimental Documents

contents.text:
Network Working Group                                     P. Nesser, II
Request for Comments: 3796                   Nesser & Nesser Consulting
Category: Informational                                A. Bergstrom, Ed.
                                              Ostfold University College
                                                               June 2004
Survey of IPv4 Addresses in Currently Deployed IETF Operations & Management Area Standards Track and Experimental Documents
contents.zh-CHS: 调查当前部署的IETF运营和管理领域标准跟踪和实验文档中的IPv4地址

contents.text: Status of this Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录的状况

contents.text: This memo provides information for the Internet community. It does not specify an Internet standard of any kind. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录为互联网社区提供信息。它没有规定任何类型的互联网标准。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.text: Copyright Notice
contents.zh-CHS: 版权公告

contents.zh-CHS: 版权所有（C）互联网协会（2004年）。

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: This document seeks to record all usage of IPv4 addresses in currently deployed IETF Operations & Management Area accepted standards. In order to successfully transition from an all IPv4 Internet to an all IPv6 Internet, many interim steps will be taken. One of these steps is the evolution of current protocols that have IPv4 dependencies. It is hoped that these protocols (and their implementations) will be redesigned to be network address independent, but failing that will at least dually support IPv4 and IPv6. To this end, all Standards (Full, Draft, and Proposed), as well as Experimental RFCs, will be surveyed and any dependencies will be documented.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档旨在记录当前部署的IETF操作和管理领域公认标准中IPv4地址的所有使用情况。为了成功地从全IPv4 Internet过渡到全IPv6 Internet，将采取许多临时步骤。其中一个步骤是发展具有IPv4依赖关系的当前协议。人们希望这些协议（及其实现）将被重新设计为与网络地址无关，但如果不能做到这一点，则至少会同时支持IPv4和IPv6。为此，将对所有标准（完整、草案和提议）以及实验性RFC进行调查，并记录任何依赖关系。

contents.text: Table of Contents
contents.zh-CHS: 目录

contents.text: 1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: This document is part of a set aiming to record all usage of IPv4 addresses in IETF standards. In an effort to have the information in a manageable form, it has been broken into 7 documents conforming to the current IETF areas (Application, Internet, Operations & Management, Routing, Security, Sub-IP and Transport).
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档是旨在记录IETF标准中IPv4地址的所有使用情况的集合的一部分。为了使信息具有可管理的形式，已将其分为符合当前IETF领域（应用、互联网、运营与管理、路由、安全、子IP和传输）的7个文件。

contents.text: For a full introduction, please see the introduction [1].
contents.zh-CHS: 有关完整的介绍，请参见介绍[1]。

contents.text: 2. Document Organization
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 文件组织

contents.text: The document is organized as described below:
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件的组织结构如下所述：

contents.text: Sections 3, 4, 5, and 6 each describe the raw analysis of Full, Draft, and Proposed Standards, and Experimental RFCs. Each RFC is discussed in its turn starting with RFC 1 and ending with (around) RFC 3100. The comments for each RFC are "raw" in nature. That is, each RFC is discussed in a vacuum and problems or issues discussed do not "look ahead" to see if the problems have already been fixed.
contents.zh-CHS: 第3节、第4节、第5节和第6节分别描述了完整、草案和拟议标准以及实验RFC的原始分析。依次讨论每个RFC，从RFC 1开始，到RFC 3100结束。每个RFC的注释本质上是“原始”的。也就是说，每个RFC都是在真空中讨论的，所讨论的问题不会“向前看”，看问题是否已经解决。

contents.text: Section 7 is an analysis of the data presented in Sections 3, 4, 5, and 6. It is here that all of the results are considered as a whole and the problems that have been resolved in later RFCs are correlated.
contents.zh-CHS: 第7节是对第3、4、5和6节中提供的数据的分析。正是在这里，所有的结果都被视为一个整体，并且在以后的RFC中解决的问题被关联起来。

contents.text: 3. Full Standards
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 完全标准

contents.text: Full Internet Standards (most commonly simply referred to as "Standards") are fully mature protocol specification that are widely implemented and used throughout the Internet.
contents.zh-CHS: 完整的互联网标准（通常简称为“标准”）是在整个互联网上广泛实施和使用的完全成熟的协议规范。

contents.text: 3.1. RFC 1155 Structure of Management Information
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1. RFC 1155管理信息结构

contents.text: Section 3.2.3.2. IpAddress defines the following:
contents.zh-CHS: 第3.2.3.2节。IpAddress定义了以下内容：

contents.text: This application-wide type represents a 32-bit internet address. It is represented as an OCTET STRING of length 4, in network byte-order.
contents.zh-CHS: 此应用程序范围的类型表示32位internet地址。它表示为长度为4的八位字节字符串，按网络字节顺序排列。

contents.text: There are several instances of the use of this definition in the rest of the document.
contents.zh-CHS: 在本文档的其余部分中有几个使用此定义的实例。

contents.text: 3.2. RFC 1212 Concise MIB definitions
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2. RFC 1212简明MIB定义

contents.text: In section 4.1.6 IpAddress is defined as:
contents.zh-CHS: 在第4.1.6节中，IP地址定义为：

contents.text: (6) IpAddress-valued: 4 sub-identifiers, in the familiar a.b.c.d notation.
contents.zh-CHS: (6) IpAddress值：4个子标识符，采用熟悉的a.b.c.d符号。

contents.text: 3.3. RFC 1213 Management Information Base
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3. RFC1213管理信息库

contents.text: There are far too many instances of IPv4 addresses is this document to enumerate here. The particular object groups that are affected are the IP group, the ICMP group, the TCP group, the UDP group, and the EGP group.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档中的IPv4地址实例太多，无法在此列举。受影响的特定对象组是IP组、ICMP组、TCP组、UDP组和EGP组。

contents.text: 3.4. RFC 2578 Structure of Management Information Version 2 (SMIv2)
contents.zh-CHS: 3.4. RFC 2578管理信息结构版本2（SMIv2）

contents.text: Section 7.1.5 defines the IpAddress data type:
contents.zh-CHS: 第7.1.5节定义了IpAddress数据类型：

contents.text: The IpAddress type represents a 32-bit internet address. It is represented as an OCTET STRING of length 4, in network byte-order.
contents.zh-CHS: IpAddress类型表示32位internet地址。它表示为长度为4的八位字节字符串，按网络字节顺序排列。

contents.text: Note that the IpAddress type is a tagged type for historical reasons. Network addresses should be represented using an invocation of the TEXTUAL-CONVENTION macro.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，出于历史原因，IpAddress类型是标记类型。网络地址应该使用文本约定宏的调用来表示。

contents.text: Note the deprecated status of this type; see RFC 3291 for details on the replacement TEXTUAL-CONVENTION definitions.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意此类型的已弃用状态；有关替换文本约定定义的详细信息，请参见RFC 3291。

SnmpUDPAddress ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION

contents.text: 4. Draft Standards
contents.zh-CHS: 4. 标准草案

contents.text: Draft Standards represent the penultimate standard level in the IETF. A protocol can only achieve draft standard when there are multiple, independent, interoperable implementations. Draft Standards are usually quite mature and widely used.
contents.zh-CHS: 标准草案代表IETF中倒数第二个标准级别。只有当存在多个独立的、可互操作的实现时，协议才能实现标准草案。标准草案通常是相当成熟和广泛使用的。

contents.text: The MIB defined in this RFC deals with objects in a BGP4 based routing system and therefore contain many objects that are limited by the IpAddress 32-bit value defined in MIB2. Clearly the values of this MIB are limited to IPv4 addresses. No update is needed, although a new MIB should be defined for BGP4+ to allow management of IPv6 addresses and routes.
contents.zh-CHS: 此RFC中定义的MIB处理基于BGP4的路由系统中的对象，因此包含许多受MIB2中定义的IpAddress 32位值限制的对象。显然，此MIB的值仅限于IPv4地址。无需更新，但应为BGP4+定义新的MIB以允许管理IPv6地址和路由。

contents.text: 4.7. RFC 1694 Definitions of Managed Objects for SMDS Interfaces using SMIv2
contents.zh-CHS: 4.7. RFC 1694使用SMIv2的SMDS接口的托管对象定义

contents.text: This MIB module definition defines the following subtree:
contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB模块定义定义了以下子树：

contents.text: ipOverSMDS OBJECT IDENTIFIER ::= { smdsApplications 1 }

-- Although the objects in this group are read-only, at the
-- agent's discretion they may be made read-write so that the
-- management station, when appropriately authorized, may
-- change the addressing information related to the
-- configuration of a logical IP subnetwork implemented on
-- top of SMDS.

-- This table is necessary to support RFC1209 (IP-over-SMDS)
-- and gives information on the Group Addresses and ARP
-- Addresses used in the Logical IP subnetwork.
-- One SMDS address may be associated with multiple IP
-- addresses.  One SNI may be associated with multiple LISs.
ipOverSMDSTable OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX SEQUENCE OF IpOverSMDSEntry MAX-ACCESS not-accessible
contents.zh-CHS: IpOverSMDSEntry MAX-ACCESS的ipOverSMDSTable对象类型语法序列不可访问

contents.text:
STATUS      current
DESCRIPTION
   "The table of addressing information relevant to
   this entity's IP addresses."
::= { ipOverSMDS 1 }

ipOverSMDSEntry OBJECT-TYPE
    SYNTAX      IpOverSMDSEntry
    MAX-ACCESS  not-accessible
    STATUS      current
    DESCRIPTION
       "The addressing information for one of this
       entity's IP addresses."
    INDEX   { ipOverSMDSIndex, ipOverSMDSAddress }
    ::= { ipOverSMDSTable 1 }

IpOverSMDSEntry ::=
    SEQUENCE {
       ipOverSMDSIndex       IfIndex,
       ipOverSMDSAddress     IpAddress,
       ipOverSMDSHA          SMDSAddress,
       ipOverSMDSLISGA       SMDSAddress,
       ipOverSMDSARPReq      SMDSAddress
       }

ipOverSMDSIndex OBJECT-TYPE
    SYNTAX      IfIndex
    MAX-ACCESS  read-only
    STATUS      current
    DESCRIPTION
       "The value of this object identifies the
       interface for which this entry contains management
       information. "
    ::= { ipOverSMDSEntry 1 }

ipOverSMDSAddress OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX      IpAddress
     MAX-ACCESS  read-only
     STATUS      current
     DESCRIPTION
       "The IP address to which this entry's addressing
       information pertains."
    ::= { ipOverSMDSEntry 2 }
ipOverSMDSHA OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX SMDSAddress MAX-ACCESS read-only STATUS current
contents.zh-CHS: ipOverSMDSHA对象类型语法SMDSAddress MAX-ACCESS只读状态当前

contents.text:
ipOverSMDSLISGA OBJECT-TYPE
    SYNTAX      SMDSAddress
    MAX-ACCESS  read-only
    STATUS      current
    DESCRIPTION
       "The SMDS Group Address that has been configured
       to identify the SMDS Subscriber-Network Interfaces
       (SNIs) of all members of the Logical IP Subnetwork
       (LIS) connected to the network supporting SMDS."
    ::= { ipOverSMDSEntry 4 }

ipOverSMDSARPReq OBJECT-TYPE
    SYNTAX      SMDSAddress
    MAX-ACCESS  read-only
    STATUS      current
    DESCRIPTION
       "The SMDS address (individual or group) to which
       ARP Requests are to be sent."
    ::= { ipOverSMDSEntry 5 }
Although these object definitions are intended for IPv4 addresses, a similar MIB can be defined for IPv6 addressing.
contents.zh-CHS: 尽管这些对象定义用于IPv4地址，但也可以为IPv6地址定义类似的MIB。

contents.text: This MIB defines managed objects for OSPFv2 which is a protocol used to exchange IPv4 routing information. Since OSPFv2 is limited to IPv4 addresses, a new MIB is required to support a new version of OSPF that is IPv6 aware.
contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB为OSPFv2定义托管对象，OSPFv2是用于交换IPv4路由信息的协议。由于OSPFv2仅限于IPv4地址，因此需要新的MIB来支持支持支持IPv6的新版本OSPF。

contents.text: 5. Proposed Standards
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 拟议标准

contents.text: Proposed Standards are introductory level documents. There are no requirements for even a single implementation. In many cases, Proposed are never implemented or advanced in the IETF standards process. They therefore are often just proposed ideas that are presented to the Internet community. Sometimes flaws are exposed or they are one of many competing solutions to problems. In these later cases, no discussion is presented as it would not serve the purpose of this discussion.
contents.zh-CHS: 拟议标准是介绍性文件。即使是单个实现也没有要求。在许多情况下，在IETF标准过程中从未实施或推进提议的标准。因此，它们通常只是向互联网社区提出的想法。有时缺陷会暴露出来，或者是许多相互竞争的问题解决方案之一。在后一种情况下，不进行讨论，因为这不符合本次讨论的目的。

contents.text: mioxPleLastFailedEnAddr OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX OCTET STRING (SIZE(2..128)) ACCESS read-only STATUS mandatory DESCRIPTION "The last Encapsulated address that failed to find a corresponding X.121 address and caused mioxPleEnAddrToX121LkupFlrs to be incremented. The first octet of this object contains the encapsulation type, the remaining octets contain the address of that type that failed. Thus for an IP address, the length will be five octets, the first octet will contain 204 (hex CC), and the last four octets will contain the IP
contents.zh-CHS: MIOxpleLastFailedEndAddr对象类型语法八位字节字符串（大小（2..128））访问只读状态强制说明“未能找到对应的X.121地址并导致mioxPleEnAddrToX121LkupFlrs递增的最后一个封装地址。此对象的第一个八位字节包含封装类型，其余八位字节包含失败类型的地址。因此，对于IP地址，长度将为五个八位字节，第一个八位字节将包含204（十六进制CC），最后四个八位字节将包含IP地址

contents.text:
address.  For a snap encapsulation, the
        first byte would be 128 (hex 80) and the
        rest of the octet string would have the snap
        header."
::= { mioxPleEntry 4 }

mioxPeerEnAddr OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX OCTET STRING (SIZE (0..128)) ACCESS read-write STATUS mandatory DESCRIPTION "The Encapsulation address of the remote host mapped by this table entry. A length of zero indicates the remote IP address is unknown or unspecified for use as a PLE default.
contents.zh-CHS: mioxPeerEnAddr对象类型语法八位字节字符串（大小（0..128））访问读写状态强制说明“此表项映射的远程主机的封装地址。长度为零表示远程IP地址未知或未指定，无法用作PLE默认地址。

contents.text:
The first octet of this object contains the
        encapsulation type, the remaining octets
        contain an address of that type.  Thus for
        an IP address, the length will be five
        octets, the first octet will contain 204
        (hex CC), and the last four octets will
        contain the IP address.  For a snap
        encapsulation, the first byte would be 128
        (hex 80) and the rest of the octet string
        would have the snap header."
DEFVAL { ''h }
::= { mioxPeerEntry 7 }

mioxPeerEncType OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX INTEGER (0..256) ACCESS read-write STATUS mandatory DESCRIPTION "The value of the encapsulation type. For IP encapsulation this will have a value of 204 (hex CC). For SNAP encapsulated packets, this will have a value of 128 (hex 80). For CLNP, ISO 8473, this will have a value of 129 (hex 81). For ES-ES, ISO 9542, this will have a value of 130 (hex 82). A value of 197 (hex C5) identifies the Blacker X.25 encapsulation. A value of 0, identifies the Null encapsulation.
contents.zh-CHS: mioxPeerEncType对象类型语法整数（0..256）访问读写状态强制说明“封装类型的值。对于IP封装，此值为204（十六进制CC）。对于快照封装的数据包，此值为128（十六进制80）。对于CLNP，ISO 8473，此值为129（十六进制81）。对于ES-ES，ISO 9542，其值为130（十六进制82）。值为197（十六进制C5）表示更黑的X.25封装。值为0表示空封装。

contents.text: This value can only be written when the mioxPeerStatus object with the same
contents.zh-CHS: 只有当mioxPeerStatus对象具有相同的

contents.text:
mioxPeerIndex has a value of underCreation.
        Setting this object to a value of 256
        deletes the entry.  When deleting an entry,
        all other entries in the mioxPeerEncTable
        with the same mioxPeerIndex and with an
        mioxPeerEncIndex higher then the deleted
        entry, will all have their mioxPeerEncIndex
        values decremented by one."
::= { mioxPeerEncEntry 2 }
Updated values of the first byte of these objects can be defined to support IPv6 addresses.

contents.text: IESG Note:

contents.text: The IP, UDP, and TCP MIB modules currently support only IPv4. These three modules use the IpAddress type defined as an OCTET STRING of length 4 to represent the IPv4 32-bit internet addresses. (See RFC 1902, SMI for SNMPv2.) They do not support the new 128-bit IPv6 internet addresses.

trapDestAddress OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX OCTET STRING MAX-ACCESS read-create STATUS current DESCRIPTION "The address to send traps on behalf of this entry.
contents.zh-CHS: TrapDesAddress对象类型语法八位字符串MAX-ACCESS read create STATUS current DESCRIPTION“代表此项发送陷阱的地址。

contents.text:
If the associated trapDestProtocol object is equal to ip(1),
the encoding of this object is the same as the snmpUDPAddress
textual convention in [RFC1906]:
  -- for a SnmpUDPAddress of length 6:
  --
  -- octets   contents        encoding
  --  1-4     IP-address      network-byte order
  --  5-6     UDP-port        network-byte order
If the associated trapDestProtocol object is equal to ipx(2),
contents.zh-CHS: 如果关联的trapDestProtocol对象等于ipx（2），

contents.text:
the encoding of this object is the same as the snmpIPXAddress
textual convention in [RFC1906]:
  -- for a SnmpIPXAddress of length 12:
  --
  -- octets   contents            encoding
  --  1-4     network-number      network-byte order
  --  5-10    physical-address    network-byte order
  -- 11-12    socket-number       network-byte order

All of the object definitions above (except trapDestProtocol) mention only IPv4 addresses. However, since they use a SYNTAX of OCTET STRING, they should work fine for IPv6 addresses. A new legitimate value of trapDestProtocol (i.e., SYNTAX addition of ipv6(3) should make this specification functional for IPv6.
contents.zh-CHS: 上述所有对象定义（trapDestProtocol除外）仅提及IPv4地址。但是，由于它们使用八位字节字符串的语法，因此对于IPv6地址，它们应该可以正常工作。trapDestProtocol的一个新合法值（即ipv6（3）的语法添加）应使本规范适用于ipv6。

contents.text: 5.32. RFC 2024 Definitions of Managed Objects for Data Link Switching using SMIv2
contents.zh-CHS: 5.32. RFC 2024使用SMIv2进行数据链路交换的托管对象定义

contents.text: The following textual conventions are defined:
contents.zh-CHS: 定义了以下文本约定：

contents.text:
TAddress ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION
    STATUS  current
    DESCRIPTION
       "Denotes a transport service address.
        For dlswTCPDomain, a TAddress is 4 octets long,
        containing the IP-address in network-byte order."
    SYNTAX  OCTET STRING (SIZE (0..255))

-- DLSw over TCP
dlswTCPDomain  OBJECT IDENTIFIER ::= { dlswDomains 1 }
-- for an IP address of length 4:
--
-- octets   contents        encoding
--  1-4     IP-address      network-byte order
--
DlswTCPAddress ::= TEXTUAL-CONVENTION
    DISPLAY-HINT "1d.1d.1d.1d"
    STATUS       current
    DESCRIPTION
            "Represents the IP address of a DLSw which uses
             TCP as a transport protocol."
    SYNTAX       OCTET STRING (SIZE (4))

Additionally there are many object definitions that use a SYNTAX of TAddress within the document. Interestingly the SYNTAX for TAddress is an OCTET string of up to 256 characters. It could easily accommodate a similar hybrid format for IPv6 addresses.
contents.zh-CHS: 此外，文档中还有许多使用TadAddress语法的对象定义。有趣的是，TAddress的语法是最多256个字符的八位字符串。它可以很容易地为IPv6地址提供类似的混合格式。

contents.text: A new OID to enhance functionality for DlswTCPAddress could be added to support IPv6 addresses.
contents.zh-CHS: 可以添加一个新的OID来增强DlswTCPAddress的功能，以支持IPv6地址。

AtmInterfaceConfEntry    ::= SEQUENCE  {
     atmInterfaceMaxVpcs             INTEGER,

atmInterfaceMyNeighborIpAddress OBJECT-TYPE
     SYNTAX         IpAddress
     MAX-ACCESS     read-write
     STATUS         current
     DESCRIPTION
      "The IP address of the neighbor system connected to
       the  far end of this interface, to which a Network
       Management Station can send SNMP messages, as IP

       of this object may be obtained in different ways,
       e.g., by manual configuration, or through ILMI
       interaction with the neighbor system."
     ::= { atmInterfaceConfEntry 11 }

atmInterfaceConfGroup2    OBJECT-GROUP
       OBJECTS {
             atmInterfaceMaxVpcs, atmInterfaceMaxVccs,
             atmInterfaceConfVpcs, atmInterfaceConfVccs,
             atmInterfaceMaxActiveVpiBits,

             atmInterfaceMyNeighborIfName,
             atmInterfaceCurrentMaxVpiBits,

       STATUS     current

       ::= { atmMIBGroups 10 }

contents.text: 5.70. RFC 2622 Routing Policy Specification Language (RPSL)
contents.zh-CHS: 5.70. RFC 2622路由策略规范语言（RPSL）

contents.text: The only objects in the version of RPSL that deal with IP addresses are defined as:
contents.zh-CHS: RPSL版本中唯一处理IP地址的对象定义为：

contents.text: <ipv4-address> An IPv4 address is represented as a sequence of four integers in the range from 0 to 255 separated by the character dot ".". For example, 128.9.128.5 represents a valid IPv4 address. In the rest of this document, we may refer to IPv4 addresses as IP addresses.
contents.zh-CHS: <ipv4地址>ipv4地址表示为由0到255之间的四个整数组成的序列，由字符点“.”分隔。例如，128.9.128.5表示有效的IPv4地址。在本文档的其余部分中，我们可以将IPv4地址称为IP地址。

contents.text: <address-prefix> An address prefix is represented as an IPv4 address followed by the character slash "/" followed by an integer in the range from 0 to 32. The following are valid address prefixes: 128.9.128.5/32, 128.9.0.0/16, 0.0.0.0/0; and the following address prefixes are invalid: 0/0, 128.9/16 since 0 or 128.9 are not strings containing four integers.
contents.zh-CHS: <address prefix>地址前缀表示为IPv4地址，后跟字符斜杠“/”和0到32之间的整数。以下是有效的地址前缀：128.9.128.5/32、128.9.0.0/16、0.0.0.0/0；以下地址前缀无效：0/0、128.9/16，因为0或128.9不是包含四个整数的字符串。

contents.text: There seems to be an awareness of IPv6 because of the terminology but it is not specifically defined. Therefore additional objects for IPv6 addresses and prefixes need to be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于术语的原因，人们似乎意识到了IPv6，但并未对其进行具体定义。因此，需要定义IPv6地址和前缀的其他对象。

contents.text: 5.72. RFC 2667 IP Tunnel MIB
contents.zh-CHS: 5.72. RFC 2667 IP隧道MIB

contents.text: The Abstract of this document says:
contents.zh-CHS: 这份文件的摘要说：

contents.text: This memo defines a Management Information Base (MIB) for use with network management protocols in the Internet community. In particular, it describes managed objects used for managing tunnels of any type over IPv4 networks. Extension MIBs may be designed for managing protocol-specific objects. Likewise, extension MIBs may be designed for managing security-specific objects. This MIB does not support tunnels over non-IPv4 networks (including IPv6 networks). Management of such tunnels may be supported by other MIBs.
contents.zh-CHS: 此备忘录定义了一个管理信息库（MIB），用于Internet社区中的网络管理协议。特别是，它描述了用于通过IPv4网络管理任何类型隧道的托管对象。扩展MIB可设计用于管理特定于协议的对象。同样，扩展MIB可以设计用于管理特定于安全性的对象。此MIB不支持非IPv4网络（包括IPv6网络）上的隧道。此类隧道的管理可由其他MIB支持。

contents.text: A similar MIB for tunneling over IPv6 should be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 应该为IPv6上的隧道定义类似的MIB。

contents.text: 5.73. RFC 2669 DOCSIS Cable Device MIB Cable Device Management Information Base for DOCSIS compliant Cable Modems and Cable Modem Termination Systems

contents.text: Please note that the DOCSIS 1.0 standard only requires Cable Modems to implement SNMPv1 and to process IPv4 customer traffic. Design choices in this MIB reflect those requirements. Future versions of the DOCSIS standard are expected to require support for SNMPv3 and IPv6 as well.

contents.zh-CHS: 此MIB定义以下对象：

contents.text:
DocsIfCmtsCmStatusEntry ::= SEQUENCE {
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusIndex               Integer32,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusMacAddress          MacAddress,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusIpAddress           IpAddress,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusDownChannelIfIndex  InterfaceIndexOrZero,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusUpChannelIfIndex    InterfaceIndexOrZero,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusRxPower             TenthdBmV,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusTimingOffset        Unsigned32,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusEqualizationData    OCTET STRING,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusValue               INTEGER,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusUnerroreds          Counter32,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusCorrecteds          Counter32,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusUncorrectables      Counter32,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusSignalNoise         TenthdB,
            docsIfCmtsCmStatusMicroreflections    Integer32
        }

docsIfCmtsCmStatusIpAddress OBJECT-TYPE
        SYNTAX      IpAddress
        MAX-ACCESS  read-only
        STATUS      current
        DESCRIPTION
            "IP address of this Cable Modem.  If the Cable Modem has no
             IP address assigned, or the IP address is unknown, this
             object returns a value of 0.0.0.0.  If the Cable Modem has
             multiple IP addresses, this object returns the IP address
             associated with the Cable interface."
        ::= { docsIfCmtsCmStatusEntry 3 }
This object needs to be deprecated and replaced by one that supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

contents.text: pingCtlDataSize OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX Unsigned32 (0..65507) UNITS "octets" MAX-ACCESS read-create
contents.zh-CHS: pingCtlDataSize对象类型语法Unsigned32（0..65507）单位“八位字节”MAX-ACCESS读取创建

contents.text:
STATUS      current
DESCRIPTION
    "Specifies the size of the data portion to be
    transmitted in a ping operation in octets.  A ping
    request is usually an ICMP message encoded
    into an IP packet.  An IP packet has a maximum size
    of 65535 octets.  Subtracting the size of the ICMP
    or UDP header (both 8 octets) and the size of the IP
    header (20 octets) yields a maximum size of 65507
    octets."
DEFVAL { 0 }
::= { pingCtlEntry 5 }

traceRouteCtlDataSize OBJECT-TYPE
   SYNTAX      Unsigned32 (0..65507)
   UNITS       "octets"
   MAX-ACCESS  read-create
   STATUS      current
   DESCRIPTION
       "Specifies the size of the data portion of a traceroute
       request in octets.  A traceroute request is essentially
       transmitted by encoding a UDP datagram into a
       IP packet.  So subtracting the size of a UDP header
       (8 octets) and the size of a IP header (20 octets)
       yields a maximum of 65507 octets."
   DEFVAL { 0 }
   ::= { traceRouteCtlEntry 6 }
The DESCRIPTION clauses need to be updated to remove the IPv4 dependencies.
contents.zh-CHS: 需要更新描述子句以删除IPv4依赖项。

contents.text: 6. Experimental RFCs
contents.zh-CHS: 6. 实验RFC

contents.text: Experimental RFCs typically define protocols that do not have widescale implementation or usage on the Internet. They are often propriety in nature or used in limited arenas. They are documented to the Internet community in order to allow potential interoperability or some other potential useful scenario. In a few cases, they are presented as alternatives to the mainstream solution to an acknowledged problem.
contents.zh-CHS: 实验性RFC通常定义在Internet上没有大规模实现或使用的协议。它们通常在性质上是恰当的，或者在有限的领域中使用。为了允许潜在的互操作性或其他一些潜在的有用场景，它们被记录到互联网社区中。在少数情况下，它们被作为主流解决方案的替代方案来解决一个公认的问题。

contents.text: 7. Summary of Results
contents.zh-CHS: 7. 结果摘要

contents.text: In the initial survey of RFCs, 36 positives were identified out of a total of 153, broken down as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 在对RFC的初步调查中，在总共153个样本中确定了36个阳性样本，细分如下：

contents.text: Standards: 6 out of 15 or 40.00% Draft Standards: 4 out of 15 or 26.67% Proposed Standards: 26 out of 112 or 23.21% Experimental RFCs: 0 out of 11 or 0.00%
contents.zh-CHS: 标准：15分之6或40.00%标准草案：15分之4或26.67%拟定标准：112分之26或23.21%实验性RFC：11分之0或0.00%

contents.text: Of those identified, many require no action because they document outdated and unused protocols, while others are document protocols that are actively being updated by the appropriate working groups. Additionally there are many instances of standards that should be updated but do not cause any operational impact if they are not updated. The remaining instances are documented below.
contents.zh-CHS: 在已确定的协议中，许多协议不需要采取行动，因为它们记录了过时和未使用的协议，而其他协议则记录了相关工作组正在积极更新的协议。此外，还有许多应更新的标准实例，但如果不更新，则不会造成任何运营影响。其余实例记录如下。

contents.text: 7.1. Standards
7.1.1. STD 16, Structure of Management Information (RFCs 1155 and 1212)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.1.1. 标准16，管理信息结构（RFCs 1155和1212）

contents.text: RFC 1155 and RFC 1212 (along with the informational document RFC 1215) define SMIv1. These documents have been superseded by RFCs 2578, 2579, and 2580 which define SMIv2. Since SMIv1 is no longer being used as the basis for new IETF MIB modules, the limitations identified in this Internet Standard do not require any action.
contents.zh-CHS: RFC 1155和RFC 1212（以及信息文档RFC 1215）定义了SMIv1。这些文件已被定义SMIv2的RFC 2578、2579和2580所取代。由于SMIv1不再用作新IETF MIB模块的基础，因此本互联网标准中确定的限制不需要采取任何措施。

contents.text: 7.1.2. STD 17 Simple Network Management Protocol (RFC 1213)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.1.2. STD 17简单网络管理协议（RFC 1213）

contents.text: The limitations identified have been addressed, because RFC 1213 has been split into multiple modules which are all IPv6 capable.
contents.zh-CHS: 已经解决了确定的限制，因为RFC 1213已拆分为多个模块，这些模块都支持IPv6。

contents.text: 7.2. Draft Standards
contents.zh-CHS: 7.2. 标准草案

contents.text: 7.2.1. BGP4 MIB (RFC 1657)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.2.1. BGP4 MIB（RFC1657）

contents.text: This problem is currently being addressed by the Inter Domain Routing (IDR) WG [2].
contents.zh-CHS: 这个问题目前正由域间路由（IDR）工作组[2]解决。

contents.text: 7.2.2. SMDS MIB (RFC 1694)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.2.2. SMDS MIB（RFC 1694）

contents.text: See Internet Area standards. Once a specification for IPv6 over SMDS is created a new MIB must be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 参见互联网区域标准。一旦创建了SMDS上的IPv6规范，就必须定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.2.3. RIPv2 MIB (RFC 1724)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.2.3. RIPv2 MIB（RFC 1724）

contents.text: There is no updated MIB module to cover the problems outlined. A new MIB module should be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 没有更新的MIB模块来解决概述的问题。应定义新的MIB模块。

contents.text: 7.2.4. OSPFv2 MIB (RFC 1850)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.2.4. OSPFv2 MIB（RFC1850）

contents.text: This problem is currently being addressed by the OSPF WG [3].
contents.zh-CHS: OSPF工作组目前正在解决这个问题[3]。

contents.text: 7.2.5. Transport MIB (RFC 1906)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.2.5. 传输MIB（RFC1906）

contents.text: RFC 1906 has been obsoleted by RFC 3417, Transport Mappings for SNMP, and the limitations of this specification have been addressed by that RFC, which defines TCs that can be used to specify transport domains in an IP version-independent way. RFC 3419 recommends that those TCs be used in place of SnmpUDPAddress when IPv6 support is required and for all new applications that are not SNMP-specific.
contents.zh-CHS: RFC 1906已被RFC 3417《SNMP的传输映射》淘汰，该RFC已解决了本规范的限制，该RFC定义了可用于以独立于IP版本的方式指定传输域的TC。RFC 3419建议，当需要IPv6支持时，以及对于所有非SNMP特定的新应用程序，使用这些TC代替SnmpUDPAddress。

contents.text: 7.3. Proposed Standards
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3. 拟议标准

contents.text: 7.3.1. MIB for Multiprotocol Interconnect over X.25 (RFC 1461)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.1. X.25上多协议互连的MIB（RFC 1461）

contents.text: This problem has not been addressed. If a user requirement for IPv6 over X.25 develops (which is thought to be unlikely) then this MIB module will need to be updated in order to accommodate it.
contents.zh-CHS: 这个问题没有得到解决。如果用户对IPv6 over X.25的需求增加（这被认为是不可能的），则需要更新此MIB模块以适应它。

contents.text: 7.3.2. PPP IPCP MIB (RFC 1473)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.2. PPP IPCP MIB（RFC 1473）

contents.text: There is no updated MIB to cover the problems outlined. A new MIB should be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 没有更新的MIB来涵盖概述的问题。应定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.3.3. Appletalk MIB (RFC 1742)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.3. Appletalk MIB（RFC 1742）

contents.text: This problem has not been addressed. If a user requirement for IPv6 over Appletalk develops (which is thought to be unlikely) then this MIB module will need to be updated (or a new MIB module will need to be created) in order to accommodate it.
contents.zh-CHS: 这个问题没有得到解决。如果在Appletalk上开发IPv6的用户需求（这被认为是不可能的），则需要更新此MIB模块（或者需要创建新的MIB模块）以适应它。

contents.text: 7.3.4. The Definitions of Managed Objects for IP Mobility Support using SMIv2 (RFC 2006)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.4. 使用SMIv2为IP移动性支持定义托管对象（RFC 2006）

contents.text: The problems are being resolved by the MIP6 WG [4].
contents.zh-CHS: MIP6工作组正在解决这些问题[4]。

contents.text: 7.3.5. SMIv2 IP MIB (RFC 2011)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.5. SMIv2 IP MIB（RFC 2011）

contents.text: This issue is being resolved by the IPv6 WG [5].
contents.zh-CHS: IPv6工作组正在解决此问题[5]。

contents.text: 7.3.6. SNMPv2 TCP MIB (RFC 2012)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.6. SNMPv2 TCP MIB（RFC 2012）

contents.text: This issue is being resolved by the IPv6 WG [6].
contents.zh-CHS: IPv6工作组正在解决此问题[6]。

contents.text: 7.3.7. SNMPv2 UDP MIB (RFC 2013)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.7. SNMPv2 UDP MIB（RFC 2013）

contents.text: This issue is being resolved by the IPv6 WG [7].
contents.zh-CHS: IPv6工作组正在解决此问题[7]。

contents.text: 7.3.8. RMON-II MIB (RFC 2021)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.8. RMON-II MIB（RFC 2021）

contents.text: This issue has been brought to the attention of the RMONMIB WG. Currently, there is a work in progress [8] to update RFC 2021, but it does not address the problems that have been identified; it is expected that there will be a resolution in a future version of that document.
contents.zh-CHS: 已提请RMONMIB工作组注意该问题。目前，有一项更新RFC 2021的工作[8]正在进行，但并未解决已确定的问题；预计该文件的未来版本将有一项决议。

contents.text: 7.3.9. DataLink Switching using SMIv2 MIB (RFC 2024)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.9. 使用SMIv2 MIB的数据链路交换（RFC 2024）

contents.text: The problems have not been addressed and an updated MIB should be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 问题尚未解决，应定义更新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.3.10. IP Forwarding Table MIB (RFC 2096)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.10. IP转发表MIB（RFC 2096）

contents.text: This issue is being worked on by the IPv6 WG [9].
contents.zh-CHS: IPv6工作组正在研究此问题[9]。

contents.text: 7.3.11. Classical IP & ARP over ATM MIB (RFC 2320)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.11. ATM MIB上的经典IP和ARP（RFC 2320）

contents.text: The current version of Classical IP and ARP over ATM (RFC 2225) does not support IPv6. If and when that protocol specification is updated to add IPv6 support, then new MIB objects to represent IPv6 addresses will need to be added to this MIB module.
contents.zh-CHS: 当前版本的经典IP和ATM上的ARP（RFC2225）不支持IPv6。如果更新该协议规范以添加IPv6支持，则需要将表示IPv6地址的新MIB对象添加到此MIB模块。

contents.text: 7.3.12. Multicast over UNI 3.0/3.1 ATM MIB (RFC 2417)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.12. UNI 3.0/3.1 ATM MIB上的多播（RFC 2417）

contents.text: The current version of Multicast over UNI 3.0/3.1 ATM (RFC 2022) does not support IPv6. If and when that protocol specification is updated to add IPv6 support, then new MIB objects to represent IPv6 addresses will need to be added to this MIB module.
contents.zh-CHS: 当前版本的UNI 3.0/3.1 ATM多播（RFC 2022）不支持IPv6。如果更新该协议规范以添加IPv6支持，则需要将表示IPv6地址的新MIB对象添加到此MIB模块。

contents.text: 7.3.13. ATM MIB (RFC 2515)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.13. ATM MIB（RFC2515）

contents.text: The AToM MIB WG is currently collecting implementation reports for RFC 2515 and is considering whether to advance, revise, or retire this specification. The problems identified have been brought to the attention of the WG.
contents.zh-CHS: AToM MIB工作组目前正在收集RFC 2515的实施报告，并正在考虑是否推进、修订或废止该规范。已提请工作组注意所发现的问题。

contents.text: The problems identified are not being addressed and a new MIB module may need to be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 发现的问题没有得到解决，可能需要定义一个新的MIB模块。

contents.text: 7.3.15. Application MIB (RFC 2564)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.15. 应用程序MIB（RFC2564）

contents.text: The problems identified are not being addressed and a new MIB module may need to be defined. One possible solution might be to use the RFC 3419 TCs.
contents.zh-CHS: 发现的问题没有得到解决，可能需要定义一个新的MIB模块。一种可能的解决方案是使用RFC 3419 TCs。

contents.text: 7.3.16. Definitions of Managed Objects for APPN/HPR in IP Networks (RFC 2584)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.16. IP网络中APPN/HPR的托管对象定义（RFC 2584）

contents.text: The problems identified are not addressed and a new MIB may be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 确定的问题未得到解决，可能会定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.3.17. RADIUS MIB (RFC 2618)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.17. RADIUS MIB（RFC 2618）

contents.text: The problems have not been addressed and a new MIB should be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些问题尚未解决，应定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.3.18. RADIUS Authentication Server MIB (RFC 2619)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.18. RADIUS身份验证服务器MIB（RFC 2619）

contents.text: The problems have not been addressed and a new MIB should be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些问题尚未解决，应定义新的MIB。

contents.text: Additional objects must be defined for IPv6 addresses and prefixes.
contents.zh-CHS: 必须为IPv6地址和前缀定义其他对象。

contents.text: [10] defines extensions to solve this issue, and it is being considered for publication.
contents.zh-CHS: [10] 定义用于解决此问题的扩展，目前正在考虑将其发布。

contents.text: 7.3.20. IPv4 Tunnel MIB (RFC 2667)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.20. IPv4隧道MIB（RFC 2667）

contents.text: The issue is being resolved.
contents.zh-CHS: 这个问题正在得到解决。

contents.text: 7.3.21. DOCSIS MIB (RFC 2669)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.21. DOCSIS MIB（RFC 2669）

contents.text: This problem is currently being addressed by the IPCDN WG.
contents.zh-CHS: IPCDN工作组目前正在解决这个问题。

contents.text: 7.3.22. RF MIB For DOCSIS (RFC 2670)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.22. 用于DOCSIS的RF MIB（RFC 2670）

contents.text: This problem is currently being addressed by the IPCDN WG [11].
contents.zh-CHS: IPCDN工作组目前正在解决这个问题[11]。

contents.text: 7.3.23. VRRP MIB (RFC 2787)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.23. VRRP MIB（RFC 2787）

contents.text: The problems have not been addressed and a new MIB may need to be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些问题尚未解决，可能需要定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.3.24. MIB For Traceroute, Pings and Lookups (RFC 2925)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.24. 用于跟踪路由、ping和查找的MIB（RFC 2925）

contents.text: The problems have not been addressed and a new MIB may need to be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些问题尚未解决，可能需要定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.3.25. IPv4 Multicast Routing MIB (RFC 2932)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.25. IPv4多播路由MIB（RFC 2932）

contents.text: The problems have not been addressed a new MIB must be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 问题尚未解决，必须定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 7.3.26. IGMP MIB (RFC 2933)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.3.26. IGMP MIB（RFC 2933）

contents.text: This problem is currently being addressed by the MAGMA WG [12].
contents.zh-CHS: MAGMA WG目前正在解决这个问题[12]。

contents.text: 7.4. Experimental RFCs
contents.zh-CHS: 7.4. 实验RFC

contents.text: 7.4.1. Protocol Independent Multicast MIB for IPv4 (RFC 2934)
contents.zh-CHS: 7.4.1. IPv4协议独立多播MIB（RFC 2934）

contents.text: The problems have not been addressed and a new MIB may need to be defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些问题尚未解决，可能需要定义新的MIB。

contents.text: 8. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 8. 安全考虑

contents.text: This memo examines the IPv6-readiness of specifications; this does not have security considerations in itself.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录审查了规范的IPv6准备情况；这本身没有安全考虑。

contents.text: The IETF invites any interested party to bring to its attention any copyrights, patents or patent applications, or other proprietary rights that may cover technology that may be required to implement this standard. Please address the information to the IETF at ietf-ipr@ietf.org.

contents.text: Acknowledgement
contents.zh-CHS: 确认

contents.text: Funding for the RFC Editor function is currently provided by the Internet Society.
contents.zh-CHS: RFC编辑功能的资金目前由互联网协会提供。
